snippet: The new moment will test the health law’s central premise — that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve the nation’s health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.
abstract: Millions of Americans will begin receiving health insurance coverage under the health care reform law as of January 1 after years of contention and a rollout hobbled by delays and technical problems; new moment in effort to overhaul country's health care system will test idea that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve nation's health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

lead_paragraph: The new moment will test the health law’s central premise — that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve the nation’s health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.

headline.main: Millions Gaining Health Coverage Under Law
headline.print_headline: Millions Gaining Health Coverage Today Under Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
